contextId.information: These two phrases mean basically the same thing and are combined for emphasis. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
contextId.quote: For everything there is an appointed time, and a season for every purpose

contextId.information: These two phrases mean the same thing and emphasize how common wicked behavior is. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
contextId.quote: I have seen the wickedness ... wickedness was there

contextId.information: The words "alive" and "walking around" mean basically the same thing and are combined for emphasis. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
These two phrases mean the same thing. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: Do not be too quick ... do not let your heart be too quick

contextId.information: These two phrases mean basically the same thing and are combined for emphasis. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
contextId.quote: lives many years, so that the days of his years are many

contextId.information: These two phrases mean basically the same thing and are combined for emphasis. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
contextId.quote: who respect God, who honor his presence

contextId.information: These two phrases share similar meanings and emphasize the importance of enjoying the basic activities of life. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
contextId.quote: eat your bread with joy, and drink your wine with a happy heart
